description_txt: stated on June 5, 2007 in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: "I'll tell you what I can tell this country: If they want a president who doesn't believe in God, there's probably plenty of choices."

description_txt: stated on July 30, 2007 in a speech in Laconia, New Hampshire.:
quote_txt: "Democrats are kind of falling over each other seeing who can raise taxes faster. It looks like they're going to raise taxes anywhere between 20 to 30 percent."

description_txt: stated on July 22, 2007 in Washington, DC:
quote_txt: "Corporate profits are up, CEO pay is up, but average wages of Americans are flat."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2007 in a TV Ad.:
quote_txt: "I used tax cuts to help create over 80,000 jobs in New Mexico."
"I'm for a three-state political solution in Iraq. (Romney) is not."

description_txt: stated on June 19, 2007 in Washington, DC.:
quote_txt: "If we increase fuel efficiency standards to 40, 45 miles a gallon, we would have to import zero oil from the Middle East."

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2007 in Detroit, Mich.:
quote_txt: "Both China and Japan have surpassed us, with Japanese cars now getting an average of 45 miles to the gallon."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2007 in a TV Ad.:
quote_txt: New Mexico moved "up to" sixth in the nation in job growth.

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2007 in Columbia, S.C.:
quote_txt: "For every single scientist that tells you (global warming is) happening and that it's our fault...I can stack up another group of reports that say just the opposite."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2007 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: "New Mexico was 46th in teacher pay (when he was elected), now we're 29th."

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2007 in a story by Reuters wire service.:
quote_txt: "We now have the greatest income inequality since the Great Depression."

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2007 in the Web.:
quote_txt: "Tommy Thompson is the father of welfare reform, creating the groundbreaking Wisconsin Works program in Wisconsin that became the model for national and international reforms."

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2007 in his campaign Web site.:
quote_txt: "Tommy Thompson created the first school choice program in the nation, giving thousands of Milwaukee students the choice of where they go to school – no matter where they live or how much money their parents make."
